prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you participate in, and what topics do you typically engage with in these spaces?
I like to go on Instagram and Reddit. I like to see topics on travel, food, Disneyland, and video games!
What types of books, movies, or TV shows do you enjoy, and how do these interests influence the kind of online content you seek out?
I don't read very many books these days, but I enjoy comedy, adventure, romance and science fiction for movies and shows.
What types of podcasts, blogs, or YouTube channels do you follow, and what specific topics or themes do you find most engaging in these mediums?
I watch a lot of Disney music videos and sing along to them. I watch a lot of video game channels as well to see play throughs of games I'm interested in. I don't listen to podcasts.

What types of online articles or blogs related to travel, food, Disneyland, video games, or other interests do you typically read, and what specific aspects or themes within these topics do you find most engaging?

I read blogs related to travel to gain travel tips from them and to read travel guides so I can get an idea of what stuff to do when I travel to new countries and cities. It's engaging to me when I learn something new.
Can you share more about the types of video games you enjoy and how you engage with them online, such as participating in forums, reading reviews, or watching live streams?

My favorite video games are Fire Emblem, Tears of the Kingdom, Pokemon and Assassin's Creed. I watch video guides and play throughs. I don't watch any live streams but I do like to read reviews about them.

What types of online content or communities related to comedy, adventure, romance, and science fiction do you engage with, and how do these interests influence your interactions or discussions within these spaces?
I don't actively engage in online communities but I do see posts of those nature on Reddit and upvote them.
What types of online content or resources do you seek out when planning a trip to Disneyland or a new city, and how do these resources influence your travel plans?
I look at travel articles and blogs of other people who have traveled there and read about how their trip went and what tips they can provide. I use them to plan my own trips

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
